text: Joyce Bryant (October 14, 1927 â€“ November 20, 2022) was an African-American singer and actress. She was popular in the late 1940s and early 1950s as a theater and nightclub performer. She became an early African-American sex symbol. She had nicknames such as "The Bronze Blond Bombshell", "the black Marilyn Monroe", "The Belter", and "The Voice You'll Always Remember". ==References== Category:1927 births Category:2022 deaths Category:American jazz singers Category:American pop singers Category:American gospel singers Category:American dancers Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:American civil rights activists Category:American stage actors Category:American autobiographers Category:Musicians from California Category:Singers from California Category:Writers from California Category:Actors from Oakland, California Category:Actors from Huntsville, Alabama Category:Musicians from Huntsville, Alabama Category:Singers from Huntsville, Alabama Category:Writers from Huntsville, Alabama
title: Joyce Bryant
